text: Today we're learning English with Mila Kunis.

Mila Kunis is one of those actresses that 
draws you in no matter what role she’s playing.

She started her career on the 
hit sitcom, That ‘70s Show

and went on to star in memorable 
movies such as Black Swan and Ted.

If you’ve ever been concerned about moving to a 
new country and having to adjust to the culture,

or language differences, then this lesson is just 
for you. In today's lesson we’ll learn more about

Mila’s experience moving from the Ukraine to the 
USA as a child, adjusting to American culture,

and her relationship with 
her husband Ashton Kutcher.

But before we get into that, if you'd like 
to watch your favorite movies and TV series

without getting lost, without missing the jokes 
and without needing subtitles, then I suggest you

hit the subscribe button and bell down below so 
you never miss out on any of our new lessons. Just

like one of our 5 million community members Talha, 
who says that since watching our lessons their

English has improved and continues to improve 
and they've even started thinking in English.

In this first scene, Mila tells 
talk show host Conan O'Brien

what it was like moving 
from the Ukraine to America.

If you’d like to practice listening to different 
accents, then I definitely recommend doanloading

our RealLife English App. It's the only place 
where with the touch of a button you can connect

to English learners around the world. The 
best part is that it’s absolutely free!

You can download it now by clicking up 
here or down in the description box below.

Or simply search for RealLife English 
in the Apple App or Google Play store!

Now let's do a quick quiz to 
see how much you've learned

by watching the interviews without 
subtitles and answering a few questions.
If you enjoyed this topic, then I highly recommend

that you continue your learning 
by watching this lesson next.
